title: Brock Davis
text:
Bryshear Barnett "Brock" Davis (born October 19, 1943) is an American former <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> <a href="outfielder">outfielder</a> whose <a href="professional%20baseball">professional</a> career, including <a href="minor%20league%20baseball">minor league</a> service, lasted for 13 seasons (1963–1975). Davis was born in <a href="Oakland%2C%20California">Oakland, California</a> and attended <a href="John%20C.%20Fremont%20High%20School">John C. Fremont High School</a> in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a> and <a href="California%20State%20University%2C%20Los%20Angeles">California State University, Los Angeles</a>. Davis attended high school with future professional baseball players <a href="Leon%20McFadden">Leon McFadden</a>, <a href="Willie%20Crawford">Willie Crawford</a>, <a href="Bobby%20Tolan">Bobby Tolan</a> and <a href="Bob%20Watson">Bob Watson</a>. He threw and batted left-handed, stood tall and weighed .
Davis made his big league debut at age 19 with the <a href="Houston%20Colt%20.45s">Houston Colt .45s</a> on April 9, 1963. He appeared in 34 games during the 1963 season (including the September 27 game in which all nine of the Colts starters were rookies) but did not see significant action in the major leagues again until 1971, when he played for the <a href="Chicago%20Cubs">Chicago Cubs</a>.
He was traded along with <a href="Jim%20Colborn">Jim Colborn</a> and <a href="Earl%20Stephenson">Earl Stephenson</a> by the Cubs to the <a href="Milwaukee%20Brewers">Milwaukee Brewers</a> for outfielder <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Cardenal">José Cardenal</a> on December 3, 1971. Davis batted .318 in 1972 in a utility role with the Brewers. His final game as a major-leaguer was on October 4, 1972.
All told, in 242 <a href="MLB">MLB</a> <a href="games%20played">games played</a>, he collected 141 <a href="hit%20%28baseball%29">hits</a>, including 12 <a href="double%20%28baseball%29">doubles</a> and five <a href="triple%20%28baseball%29">triples</a>, 43 <a href="runs%20batted%20in">runs batted in</a>. On June 14, 1963, Davis hit the only home run of his major-league career, against <a href="Jack%20Sanford">Jack Sanford</a> of the <a href="San%20Francisco%20Giants">San Francisco Giants</a>.
